metadata.title: CVE-2023-52594 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: wifi:ath9k: Fix potential array-index-out-of-bounds read in ath9k_htc_txstatus()Fix an array-index-out-of-bounds read in ath9k_htc_txstatus(). The bugoccurs when txs->cnt, data from a URB provided by a USB device, is biggerthan the size of the array txs->txstatus, which is HTC_MAX_TX_STATUS.WARN_ON() already checks it, but there is no bug handling code after thecheck. Make the function return if that is the case. Found by a modifiedversion of syzkaller. UBSAN: array-index-out-of-bounds in htc_drv_txrx.cindex 13 is out of range for type '__wmi_event_txstatus [12]' Call Trace:ath9k_htc_txstatus ath9k_wmi_event_tasklet tasklet_action_common__do_softirq irq_exit_rxu sysvec_apic_timer_interrupt

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52594` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-262-generic - 4.4.0-262.296
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-262-generic - 4.4.0-262.296
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-262-lowlatency - 4.4.0-262.296
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-232-generic - 4.15.0-232.244~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-232-generic - 4.15.0-232.244~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-232-lowlatency - 4.15.0-232.244~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1140-kvm - 4.4.0-1140.151
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1177-aws - 4.4.0-1177.192
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1176-aws - 4.15.0-1176.189~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1184-azure - 4.15.0-1184.199~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1169-gcp - 4.15.0-1169.186~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1138-oracle - 4.15.0-1138.149~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-262.296').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-232.244~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1140.151').

linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1176.189~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1184.199~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1169.186~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1138.149~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
